name: sfchronicle
text:
Buster Posey is ready to slip back into his Giants uniform and play ball in 2021.

Manager Gabe Kapler said he's a "surefire lock" to be on the Opening Day roster and get the majority of games behind the plate.

https://t.co/tkZ1Pwplia

name: sfchronicle
text:
As 2020 draws to a close, @SusanSlusser has one last A's Mailbag to deliver — with reader questions about the A’s many free agents and other possible changes for Oakland in 2021.

https://t.co/iNDZjTsf8Y

name: sfchronicle
text: “It’s a year that’s come at us with every possible chance it had, and every punch is a knockout punch.” Chronicle photojournalist Carlos Avila Gonzalez (@CAGisMe) says, looking back at 2020. “But we have to keep getting back up.” https://t.co/QedjiciGAW

text:
If the 49ers don’t pick up kicker Robbie Gould's option, it’s unlikely he would return in 2021 on a new discount contract.

So what will the team do?

text: RT @akoseff: "California helped pioneer mass incarceration in the '70s, '80s and '90s, despite our progressive reputation," @Scott_Wiener said, "and now it should be on California to help lead the way out of mass incarceration." https://t.co/Me9BsdpcfV

text: RT @sfc_opinions: Barring an organized resistance by children, our best hope for saving kids is to smuggle their interests into policies that protect adults first. https://t.co/ujZVipNkb1

text: California is receiving 327,000 initial doses of the Pfizer vaccine in its first round, and expects to receive a second round of 327,000 doses within three weeks. https://t.co/cqqgfskQ7I
